General Knowledge.name: Curiosities & Conundrums
General Knowledge.description: Delve into a collection of intriguing facts and puzzling questions spanning various topics. Test your knowledge of measurements, nautical terms, and more in this eclectic quiz.

questions.text: When it comes to measuring horses, how long is a 'hand'?
questions.hint: This measurement is roughly the width of a human palm.

questions.text: What is the proper nautical use of an anchor?
questions.hint: This device is used to keep a vessel stationary in the water.
questions.option3: to hold a ship in place

questions.text: What is the correct spelling of New Mexico's largest city?
questions.hint: This city’s name includes a tricky combination of letters, often misspelled.

questions.text: What letters are on the '3' button of a touch-tone telephone?
questions.hint: These letters follow ‘ABC’ on the phone keypad.

questions.text: What is the final word of the Pledge of Allegiance?
questions.hint: This word emphasizes unity and inclusivity in the pledge.

questions.text: What does the Latin phrase 'e pluribus unum' mean?
questions.hint: This motto on U.S. currency reflects the unity of the states.

questions.text: How many axles does a standard automobile have?
questions.hint: Consider the number of wheel pairs on a typical car.

questions.text: How many $100 bills does it take to equal one million dollars?
questions.hint: Calculate by dividing one million by the value of a single bill.

General Knowledge.name: Sayings & Standards
General Knowledge.description: Explore common phrases, measurement systems, and cultural norms from around the world. This quiz challenges your understanding of idioms, weights and measures, and etiquette.

questions.text: According to the popular saying, what should you do 'when in Rome'?
questions.hint: The saying suggests adapting to the customs of the place you're visiting.

questions.text: How many ounces are in a pound?
questions.hint: This is a common unit conversion in the U.S. customary system for weight.

questions.text: On a set of jumper cables, what color designates the negative connector?
questions.hint: This color is often associated with grounding in electrical systems.

questions.text: In the phrase 'Y2K' what does 'K' stand for?
questions.hint: This letter represents a numerical value in the context of the millennium bug.

questions.text: What is the singular form of the word 'graffiti'?
questions.hint: This term comes from Italian and refers to a single piece of street art.

questions.text: To make an international telephone call from within the US, what are the first numbers you should dial?
questions.hint: These digits signal that the call is leaving the country.

questions.text: What is considered the proper way to address a duke?
questions.hint: This title reflects the duke’s high rank in the British peerage system.

questions.text: For a man and woman on a date, 'dutch treat' means what?
questions.hint: This term implies fairness in sharing expenses during an outing.

General Knowledge.name: Global Tidbits
General Knowledge.description: Test your knowledge of international terms and concepts. From British slang to Arabic numerals, this quiz explores the nuances of different cultures.

questions.text: What is called a 'lorry' in Britain?
questions.hint: This vehicle is used for transporting goods, similar to a semi in the U.S.

questions.text: How is the Arabic numeral for '2' written?
questions.hint: This is the standard digit used in most modern numerical systems worldwide.

questions.text: Including the bottom, how many sides are on a square-based pyramid?
questions.hint: A square base has four sides, and the pyramid has four triangular faces.

General Knowledge.name: Time & Tools
General Knowledge.description: Explore the intricacies of timekeeping, essential tools, and everyday objects. This quiz challenges your understanding of military time, skeleton keys, and more.

questions.text: How many quarts are there in a gallon?
questions.hint: This is a standard conversion in U.S. liquid measurements, often used for milk or gas.

questions.text: What's unique about a skeleton key?
questions.hint: This key’s versatility makes it a master at opening multiple doors.

questions.text: A flashing red traffic light signifies that a driver should do what?
questions.hint: Think about what a red light typically means at an intersection, especially when it's not steady.

questions.text: To ward off bad luck, what do many people do to wood?
questions.hint: This superstitious action is often done after saying something tempting fate.

General Knowledge.name: Money & Measurements
General Knowledge.description: Dive into the world of currency, dimensions, and standard sizes. This quiz tests your knowledge of British pounds, letter sizes, and Visa card numbers.

questions.text: In British currency, how many pence make a pound?
questions.hint: This is similar to how many cents make a dollar in U.S. currency.

questions.text: What are the dimensions of a 'letter size' piece of paper?
questions.hint: This is the standard size for most printers and office documents in the U.S.

questions.text: How is the word 'ambulance' normally written on the front of American ambulances?
questions.hint: The writing is designed to be readable in a rearview mirror.

questions.text: How many digits are in a standard Visa credit card number?
questions.hint: This number is typically longer than a phone number but shorter than a bank account number.

questions.text: If you have a 'sawbuck' how much money do you have?
questions.hint: This slang term refers to a bill with a specific denomination, tied to the number 10.

General Knowledge.name: New Mexico Notes
General Knowledge.description: Discover fascinating facts about the Land of Enchantment. This quiz explores New Mexico's nickname, measurements, and international phone calls.

questions.text: What is New Mexico's nickname?
questions.hint: This nickname reflects the state’s scenic beauty and cultural mystique.

questions.text: What is another way of writing 'six feet'?
questions.hint: This notation uses a single mark to represent the foot measurement.

questions.text: To make an international telephone call from within the US, what are the first numbers you should dial?
questions.hint: These digits signal that the call is leaving the country.

General Knowledge.description: Test your knowledge of vehicles, numbers, and communication. This quiz covers axles, ambulances, phone numbers, and Arabic numerals.

questions.hint: Consider the number of wheel pairs on a typical car.

questions.text: How is the word 'ambulance' normally written on the front of American ambulances?

General Knowledge.description: Explore the rules of the road and the customs of communication. This quiz covers traffic signals, the Pledge of Allegiance, and Visa card numbers.

questions.text: How many quarts are there in a gallon?
questions.hint: This is a standard conversion in U.S. liquid measurements, often used for milk or gas.

General Knowledge.name: Quarts & Questions
General Knowledge.description: Test your knowledge of measurements, time, and communication. This quiz covers gallons, military time, and Visa card numbers.

questions.text: How is 4:00 pm expressed in military time?
questions.hint: Military time uses a 24-hour clock, so add 12 to the afternoon hour.

questions.text: How many digits are in a standard Visa credit card number?
questions.hint: This number is typically longer than a phone number but shorter than a bank account number.

questions.text: Including the bottom, how many sides are on a square-based pyramid?
questions.hint: A square base has four sides, and the pyramid has four triangular faces.

questions.hint: Calculate by dividing one million by the value of a single bill.

questions.text: How is the Arabic numeral for '2' written?
questions.hint: This is the standard digit used in most modern numerical systems worldwide.

questions.hint: This superstitious action is often done after saying something tempting fate.

questions.hint: This term comes from Italian and refers to a single piece of street art.
